text:
apr_file_info.h uses a member of apr_ino_t type in the apr_finfo_t structure.

On unices apr_ino_t is typedef'ed to ino_t. The size of ino_t is not fixed on
LFS capable architectures: it varies with the value of _FILE_OFFSET_BITS: 
for _FILE_OFFSET_BITS=32 it is 4 bytes long
for _FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 it is 8 bytes long.

If apr_ino_t would be typedef'ed to a value invariant with respect to the value
of _FILE_OFFSET_BITS, and which would be equal to the size of ino_t on that
architecture when _FILE_OFFSET_BITS is at the default value, the ABI would not
change.
creator: Lucian.Grijincu@gmail.com
Lucian.Grijincu@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 20847
Patch for 1.2.x branch head

Fixes the bug on 1.2.x architectures by typedef-ing apr_ino_t at ./configure
time to a compatible value.

creator: Lucian.Grijincu@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 20848
Patch for 0.9.x branch head

same approach as 1.2.x.

creator: Lucian.Grijincu@gmail.com

Patch for trunk head

same approach as 1.2.x and 0.9.x
